abstract.p: Prof Lee Spector reply to Ingrid Newkirk's May 4 letter warns future robots may be able to feel pain and fear

block.p: I was alarmed to read a letter from Ingrid Newkirk, president of People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals, advocating the mistreatment of robotic pets (''Robot as Pets,'' Incoming, May 4). Only the most carbo-centric throwbacks to the 20th century would deny that future robots may also have the ability to feel pain and fear. I hope that PETA is prepared to champion the rights of our robotic brethren with the same devotion that it dedicates to our admittedly more cuddly household pets.
The writer is an associate professor of computer science, the MacArthur chair, at the School of Cognitive Science at Hampshire College.
